title: Launchpad/Landpad status field
description: Model returned from the Launchpads endpoint contains `Status` field which is defined as enum (https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API/blob/master/docs/v4/launchpads/schema.md):  "status": { "type": "String", "enum": [ "active", "inactive", "unknown", "retired", "lost", "under construction" ], "required": true },  The model returned from the Landpads endpoint has also a similar one, but in the schema, it's defined just as a plain string (https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API/blob/master/docs/v4/landpads/schema.md):  "status": { "type": "String", "default": null },  Shouldn't be the second one exactly the same as the first one? From what I saw comparing data from both endpoints, this field has exactly the same meaning and the same values.
text_for_topic_modeling: launchpad landpad status field model returned launchpads endpoint contains status field defined enum https github spacex spacex api blob docs launchpads schema status type string enum active inactive unknown retired lost construction required true model returned landpads endpoint also similar one schema defined plain string https github spacex spacex api blob docs landpads schema status type string default null second one exactly first one saw comparing data endpoints field exactly meaning values
combined_text: Launchpad/Landpad status field Model returned from the Launchpads endpoint contains `Status` field which is defined as enum (https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API/blob/master/docs/v4/launchpads/schema.md):  "status": { "type": "String", "enum": [ "active", "inactive", "unknown", "retired", "lost", "under construction" ], "required": true },  The model returned from the Landpads endpoint has also a similar one, but in the schema, it's defined just as a plain string (https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API/blob/master/docs/v4/landpads/schema.md):  "status": { "type": "String", "default": null },  Shouldn't be the second one exactly the same as the first one? From what I saw comparing data from both endpoints, this field has exactly the same meaning and the same values.

title: Launches query (v4) with populate 'crew' options doesn't work
description: I use the query for launches for my app as follows:  { "query": "", "options": { "populate": [ // other populate options works correct { "path": "crew", "select": "-launches" }, ], "pagination": false } }  Some days ago it starts to send broken response without crew populated on;ly with id in array. Is it error or feature mentioned in https://github.com/r-spacex/SpaceX-API/issues/842? Should I update my app with v5 launches query?

title: Error on post to launches/query
description: Hey, I'm getting an error "Cannot read property 'replace' of undefined" for every post request to the "api.spacexdata.com/v4/launches/query" if the request contains "populate" option. Yesterday everything worked fine, I suppose the cause lies in the last commits. Please, take a look

title: core/cap issues
description: Sorry for all the issues being reported. This one's two parts When fetching cap or core info for a single part (example: https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/cores/B1036) it shouldn't return an array, just a single object Also, the wiki entry for cap endpoints is incorrect. It lists the url as https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/caps/C106/ when it should be https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/caps/C106 as the first url produces an error
text_for_topic_modeling: core cap issues sorry issues reported one two parts fetching cap core single part example https api spacexdata parts cores return array single object also wiki entry cap endpoints incorrect lists url https api spacexdata parts caps https api spacexdata parts caps first url produces
combined_text: core/cap issues Sorry for all the issues being reported. This one's two parts When fetching cap or core info for a single part (example: https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/cores/B1036) it shouldn't return an array, just a single object Also, the wiki entry for cap endpoints is incorrect. It lists the url as https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/caps/C106/ when it should be https://api.spacexdata.com/v1/parts/caps/C106 as the first url produces an error

title: Error code inconsistency between docs and API
description: The documentation states (for every endpoint which returns a single object) that for request with non-existing in database ID should return 404 code (Not Found), but it seems that API returns 400 (Bad Request) - is this a bug or typo in docs? Personally I think that 404 would be more logical and descriptive than generic 400. For https://api.spacexdata.com/v4/dragons/5e9d058759b1ff75a7ad5f8f API returns "Not Found" text and 400 error code: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26147774/87666641-4157fb80-c769-11ea-98d2-6f4985f1dab9.png)
patched_file_types: source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file

title: Dragon C207 info outdated.
description: Capsule `5f6f99fddcfdf403df379709` represents outdated information. Firstly, a wrong count of `water_landings`. It is currently showing 1, but after Insipration4 splashed down it should increase to 2 (Crew-1 and Inspiration4 water landings). Also the `last_update` value seems a little off. It refers to Crew-1 splashdown which happened in May and not Inspiration4. Reuse count and a launches list are fine. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/77860645/140494064-ead07b13-e139-4003-97aa-0b5dd9104d0c.png)
text_for_topic_modeling: dragon outdated capsule fddcfdf represents outdated information firstly wrong count water landings currently showing insipration splashed increase crew inspiration water landings also last value seems little refers crew splashdown happened may inspiration reuse count launches list fine image https user images githubusercontent ead png
